Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates by stating that Johannesburg is the most radioactive city on Earth.
Understate: The claim understates the difference between uranium contamination and radioactivity.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as there has been no consistent measuring of radioactivity in Johannesburg.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that uranium contamination directly correlates with the highest levels of radiation.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim acknowledges that the Iranian city of Ramsar has higher levels of radiation, providing an alternative explanation.
